intro: Plantago bellardii, commonly known as the broadleaf plantain, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its broad, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically in late summer. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands, ditches, and along roadsides. Plantago bellardii is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
